intro: Echinocereus engelmannii subsp. variegatus, commonly known as the variegated hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, spiny cactus with a distinctive appearance featuring bright green to blue-green stems covered in white or pale blue spines. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a vibrant contrast to its foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique coloration and resilience make it a popular choice for desert gardens and rockeries.
